intro: Ouratea brunneopurpurea, commonly known as the purple-leaf ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking purple and bronze foliage, which contrasts with its small, white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivated gardens and greenhouses.
